summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the interview of Steve Scully on August 13, 2019, in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. Scully reviewed a photobook of 85 individuals associated with the Epstein investigation and provided statements recognizing several people and describing activities and individuals on Epstein's private island.

persons.name: Steve Scully
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI and a detective in St. Thomas; reviewed a photobook and provided statements about individuals and activities on Jeffrey Epstein's private island.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Recognized by Scully from a photo (Page 5) during the photobook review.

persons.name: Miles Alexander
persons.context: Recognized by Scully from a photo (Page 18) as a younger version; Scully was talking with him when he encountered Alan Dershowitz in the kitchen.

persons.name: Boscoe
persons.context: Told Scully that an individual (name redacted) did special projects for Epstein and identified another individual (name redacted) as 'II'.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Seen by Scully in the kitchen on the island with his bodyguard, Andrew.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Seen by Scully in the kitchen on the island with Alan Dershowitz.

connections.description: Scully was talking with Miles Alexander when he walked into the kitchen and encountered Alan Dershowitz.
Boscoe provided information to Scully about individuals on the island and their roles.
Andrew is identified as Dershowitz's bodyguard and was with him on the island.
Maxwell is a known associate of Epstein; her recognition in the photobook ties her to the investigation.

events.title: Interview of Steve Scully
events.description: Steve Scully was interviewed by a detective and an FBI Special Agent in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. He reviewed a photobook of 85 individuals associated with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Post-9/11 Cabana Rebuild
events.description: Scully states that Epstein had workers completely rebuild his cabana because they did not use stainless steel screws, and he believes this occurred after 9/11.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's private island (Little St. James)
keyFacts: Steve Scully reviewed an 85-person photobook and recognized several individuals associated with Epstein's island, including Ghislaine Maxwell and Miles Alexander.
Scully stated that Epstein 'had a type. He liked blonde girls. He didn't seem to like Asian girls.' and that Epstein had a bed in his office.
Scully reported seeing five girls on the dock who he was told were all Victoria's Secret models, and he saw Alan Dershowitz and his bodyguard Andrew in the kitchen on the island.
Financial operations are mentioned: checks for the island came from a New York office and were sent to the American Yacht Harbor office.
The document contains multiple redactions of individual names, indicating the identification of additional persons of interest whose names are not publicly disclosed.
